title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 303.3 - Appointment of administrator
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 303.3 - Appointment of administrator

State Regulations
(a) The

Attorney General shall appoint an administrator or administrators to a definite
term not to exceed two years. The term shall be renewable. (b) The following criteria shall be
considered in the selection of an administrator: capability, objectivity, non-affiliation with a supplier's arbitration program, reliability, experience, financial stability, extent of geographic coverage, and fee
structure. (c) The Attorney General
shall give appropriate public notice at least 60 days prior to the expiration
of an administrator's term inviting any interested qualified party to apply in
writing for the position of administrator within 30 days from the date of the
public notice. (d) Upon a vacancy
occurring prior to the expiration of an administrator's term, the time periods
in subdivision (c) of this section shall not apply and the Attorney General
shall take appropriate steps to assure the continued administration of the
program. Notes

Adopted

New

York State Register July 31, 2019/Volume XLI, Issue 31, eff. 7/31/2019

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
